lines.text: After grabbing your most valuable items and packaging your life in a matter of minutes, you drove until the looming clouds behind you felt more like a distant nightmare than an active threat.
Your knuckles are white on the steering wheel, breaths tight in your chest as you drive on in silece.
In the distance, you can see something that looks like a mechanic shop.
The place looks recently abandoned, cars still hoisted in the air and doors half-propped.
You look around and realize that everything is similarly abandoned, streets empty.
With a deep breath, you walk into the shop.
You start rooting through bins and bags, trying to find anything that might be useful to you.
Hmm... nothing here... maybe over there..?
Oh, shit. You duck behind a car and pray you didn't get spotted.
There's no reason to hide if you're friendly.
THIS IS THE DEFAULT RAINING DIALOGUE.
BLAH BLAH CHECKING THAT LINE READING WORKS.
